p: Carvacrol and carvacryl acetate at 2 mg/ml showed 100% larval motility inhibition as compared to other compounds. Similarly, carvacryl acetate (0.2 mg/ml) and citronellal (2 mg/ml) totally reduced the motility of adult parasites in vitro. However, citronellal was moderately toxic in mice. Anethole and carvone significantly reduced fecal egg count, decreased male length, and reproductive capacity of female at 50 mg/kg concentration in vivo ( Table 3).
